fluff.name: The InkMagus
entries: A bald human, covered head to toe in black, geomteric tattoos, meditates upon a pillar. He remains motionless, the wind swirling about ruffling his clothes yet seemingly leaving him untouched. In a moment, he opens his eyes, and begins to descend a new vision set in his heart for the future of the world.A forest gnome, her skin dappled with ink like the shadows of a forest, moves silently through the trees, crossing a glade before disappearing again the moment she enters folliage.When she reaches the orc hunting party, she suddenly leaps forward in a bust of action, whirling blades shrieking out of the trees.A half-elven gambler sits at the table, the forearms poking out from his sleeves marked with four-leaved clovers and six- sided dice amongst flowing black lines. The duergar gather around expecting this new comer to lose everything as the fate of the captives comes down to a single die roll The die seems about to settle, then suddenly rolls on, landing with two sixes and guaranteeing the half-elf his victory. As the dwarves rage and shout in disbelief, a slight smile tweaks the half-elf’s lips.These individuals are radically different in many ways, but each is tied to the others by one thing: they are defined above all, by the magical tattoos they bear. More than simply decoration, these powerful tattoos imbue the wearer with magical powers, revealing mysteries, filling the body with arush of adrenaline, or even banding chance in your favour.This is the mark of the inkmagus, a magic-wielder who drawsupon the power of mystical tattoos.Different inkmagi draw their power from different sources: some from the life force that pulses through all creation, others from ancestor spirits, some from divine meditation, some from the magic of the Weave. For every inkmagus, whatever the source of their power, this power is channeled and controlled through tattoos with magical force

entries.name: Colour and Vibrancy
entries: For those who follow the path of the inkmagus, their own body becomes a work of art, to be built upon and developed over the course of a lifetime. As an inkmagus, your skin is your canvas, and you express your identity and values through the style and pattern of tattoos you bear. inkmagi have an eye for colour and form, and usually try to design their tattoos in such a way as to both exacerbate the features they find aesthetically pleasing in their own form and to abstract away from their physical body to present an image which is broader and larger than just their own four limbs.Wherever this class provides a description for a tattoo, this is intended as a launching platform and an inspiration, not as a prescription. Although the tattoos detailed below are those widely developed by inkmagi, each inkmagus will have their own interpretation of the correct colour, shape, and form of every tattoo, which both captures the universal imagery of the tattoos and simultaneously expresses their individuality and personality.

entries.name: Every Mark has a Story
entries: For an inkmagus, no two tattoos are the same, and every tattoo has a story to tell As an inkmagus, the tattoos you choose should reflect your character’s history and trajectory, the people and places they have encountered in life, and the lessons they have learned.When you choose your early tattoos, consider how they reflect your character’s history and ideals, the things and people that really matter to them. As you continue on your adventures, you may find that the content of those adventures begin to inform the tattoos you choose, such as choosing a tattoo to comemorate a recently fallen comrade, or a particular grand adventure.While you do not need to tell the stories of every tattoo you have, try to at least have a vague idea of what each tattoo means to your character, and the story they could tell

entries.name: Creating an Inkmagus
entries: As you create your inkmagus, two major questions should guide your design: who taught you the art of crafting magic tattoos, and how connected are you with the ancient traditions? Most inkmagi train under a master. Did you train under an established master with many pupils? Perhaps your master was a lone wanderer, driven away as a heretic for his unusual take on inkmagus traditions. Or perhaps you developed your techniques yourself, either from instructional tomes or by a stroke of inspiration. If you had a mentor, you should determine what your relationship with them was like, and why you left.Related to your mentor is your connection with the ancient traditions. The art of magical tattoos is founded in a tradition filled with complex rituals and intricate symbolsim, handed down from master to apprentice over many generations.

classFeature.name: Imagry
entries: You are adapt with expressing meaning through complex symbolism and imagery, which functions like a second language to you. When you paint or sketch a picture, you can encode in that picture a short hidden message, up to a few sentences long. You and other creatures who know this picture language can see and understand any such message in a picture. Other creatures that do not know this language can spot the message with a successful DC 15 Intelligence (History) check related to art history, but they can’t decipher it without magic.

classFeature.name: Inkcasting
entries: Your body is covered with a number of powerful tattoos, drawn on your skin as part of an ancient ritual and imbued with magical power, which you can draw upon to produce magical effects.Inkcasting follows the general rules of spellcasting unless otherwise stated, as found in the Player’s Handbook.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: Your body is marked with a number of smaller tattoos that can be invoked at will to produce simple magic effects. Each tattoo is tied to a single cantrip, which you can invoke the tattoo to produce. You start with two cantrip tattoos of your choice. Choose two cantrips from the inkmagus spell list, detailed below. You gain a tattoo associated with each cantrip, and you can cast those cantrips from your tattoos. (This counts as knowing those cantrips).You gain an additional cantrip tattoo at 4th level, and a further cantrip tattoo at 10th level

entries.name: Personal Ink
entries: You do not know or prepare spells of 1st level or higher, as other classes do. Instead, your body is marked with a number of magical inks, which either provide perpetual magical protection or can be invoked to produce magical effects.You start with one ink. Choose your ink from the inks options at the end of the class description. You can only choose an ink for which you fulfil the prerequisites.You gain additional inks at higher levels, as specified in the “personal ink” column of the Inkmagus table.

entries.name: Arcane Needle
entries: you create an Arcane Needle, a ﬁnely tuned tool that allows you to etch beautiful art on people’s skin, magical or not. You can now create magical tattoos of common rarity.to create a magical tattoo you must learn how to imbue a mundane tattoo with magical energy, the amount of magical tattoos you can learn each level is specified in the “Tattoos Learned” column of the Inkmagus table. when you create your charecter pick one tattoo from the magical tattoo list and add it to your list of tattoos known.Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch a person with your arcane needle and mark them with one of your tattoos, turning it into a magic tattoo.Your magic tattoo remains on a person indefinitely, but when you die, the magical tattoo vanishes after a number of days have passed equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 day).You can tattoo more than one person at the end of a long rest; the maximum number of magical tattoos you can have on others appears in the “tattoo slots” column of the Inkmagus table. You must touch each of them with the arcane needle, and each of your tattoos can be only on one person at a time. If you try to exceed your maximum number of tattoos, the oldest tattoo immediately vanishes, and then the new tattoo applies. additionally, you can mark your own skin with a common magical tattoo without having to spend a tattoo slot.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your inkmagus spells, since your magic draws upon an intimate knowledge of the art form. You use your Intelligence modifier whenever spell or tattoo effects refer to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for an inkmagus spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: The tattoos on your body act as a spellcasting focus for your inkmagus spells.

subclassFeature.name: Tattoo Artist Specialist
entries: You have focused your efforts twards helping people with your skills and learned how to imbue your tattoos with more potent magical energy. you also discovered that your arcane needle can do more than just ink.

subclassFeature.name: Art in Violance
entries: When you adopt this specialty at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with light armor. Additionally, you gain proficiency with the Sleight of Hand skill. Finally, you gain proficiency with Painter’s supplies.

subclassFeature.name: Tattoo Artist Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Tattoo Artist Spells table. These spells count as Inkmagus spells for you, but they don’t count against the number of InkMagus spells you know
